verses.text: 彼得約翰在公議會受審使徒們正對群眾講話的時候，祭司、聖殿的守衛，和撒都該人來到他們那裡。

words.note: Refers to the Jewish high court.
Lit. 'sent followers'.
A Jewish sect in the time of Jesus.

verses.text: 因為使徒教訓群眾，並且傳揚耶穌從死人中復活，他們就非常惱怒，

words.note: Lit. 'not ordinary'.

verses.text: 於是下手拿住使徒。那時天已經晚了，就把他們拘留到第二天。

words.note: Used to pre-position the direct object before the verb.

verses.text: 然而有許多聽道的人信了，男人的數目，約有五千。

words.note: Refers to hearing spiritual teachings/the gospel.

verses.text: 第二天，猶太人的官長、長老、經學家，都聚集在耶路撒冷，

words.note: Lit. 'Judea people'.
Experts in Jewish law and scripture.

verses.text: 還有大祭司亞那和該亞法、約翰、亞歷山大，以及大祭司的家人，所有的人都在那裡。

words.note: Refers to the chief priest in ancient Israelite or Jewish religion.

verses.text: 他們叫使徒都站在當中，查問說：「你們憑甚麼能力，奉誰的名作這事？」

words.note: Refers to those sent by Jesus to preach the Gospel.

words.definition: in the name of, comply with
words.note: Formal verb implying respect or authority, common in religious contexts.

verses.text: 當時彼得被聖靈充滿，對他們說：「民眾的領袖和長老啊！

words.note: Refers to the third person of the Trinity.
Refers to respected leaders, often in a religious or community context.

verses.text: 我們今天受審，如果是為了在那殘疾人身上所行的善事，就是這個人怎麼會好的，

words.note: Forms a noun phrase or passive construction.

verses.text: 那麼，你們各位和以色列全民都應當知道，站在你們面前這人好了，是因拿撒勒人耶穌基督的名。這位耶穌基督，你們把他釘死在十字架上，　神卻使他從死人中復活。

words.note: Respectful term for addressing a group of people.
Refers to Jesus, who came from Nazareth.
Introduces the object of a verb, indicating its disposal.
Refers to the cross of crucifixion.
Capitalized when referring to the singular God of the Bible.
To come back to life after death.

verses.text: 這耶穌是你們『建築工人所棄的石頭，成了房角的主要石頭。』

words.note: Often precedes a verb to form a nominalized phrase.
Refers to the main stone at a building's corner.

verses.text: 除了他以外，別無拯救，因為在天下人間，沒有賜下別的名，我們可以靠著得救。」
他們看見彼得和約翰的膽量，也知道這兩個人是沒有學問的平民，就很驚奇；同時認出他們是跟耶穌一夥的，

words.note: Implies being part of a group or faction.

verses.text: 又看見那醫好了的人，和他們一同站著，就沒有話可辯駁。
於是吩咐他們到公議會外面去，彼此商議，

words.note: The supreme judicial council of ancient Israel.

verses.text: 說：「對這些人我們應該怎麼辦呢？因為有一件人所共知的神蹟，藉著他們行了出來，所有住在耶路撒冷的人都知道，我們也無法否認。

words.definition: what to do, how to handle

words.note: Indicates the following verb affects the object, forming a nominal phrase.
Indicates something coming into existence or becoming evident.

verses.text: 為了避免這件事在民間越傳越廣，我們應該警告他們，不許再奉這名向任何人談道。」

words.note: Used in the '越...越...' structure.
Used in the '越...越...' structure.

words.definition: in the name of, to offer
words.note: Often used in religious contexts like '奉...的名' (in the name of...).
Specifically refers to discussing or spreading religious teachings.

verses.text: 於是叫了他們來，嚴禁他們再奉耶穌的名講論教導。

words.definition: in the name of, to offer
words.note: Often used in religious contexts like '奉...的名' (in the name of...).

verses.text: 彼得和約翰回答：「聽從你們過於聽從　神，在　神面前對不對，你們自己說吧！

words.note: An ideographic space used for reverence before a divine name.
An ideographic space used for reverence before a divine name.

words.definition: right or wrong, correct or not

verses.text: 我們看見的聽見的，不能不說！」

words.note: Double negative expressing strong affirmation.

verses.text: 眾人因著所發生的事，都頌讚　神，於是公議會為了群眾的緣故，也因為找不到藉口懲罰他們，就恐嚇一番，把他們放了。

words.note: Lit. 'that which happened'
Refers to the Jewish high court in ancient Israel.
Indicates a brief, often intense, action.
Used in 'ba' sentence structure.

verses.text: 原來藉著神蹟醫好的那人，有四十多歲了。
信徒同心祈禱彼得和約翰被釋放了之後，回到自己的人那裡去，把祭司長和長老說的一切，都告訴他們。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to mean unity of purpose.
Refers to church elders or leaders in a community.

verses.text: 他們聽了，就同心向　神高聲說：「主啊，你是那創造天地、海洋和其中萬物的主宰。

words.note: Often used in religious contexts to mean unity of purpose.

verses.text: 你曾以聖靈藉著你僕人我們祖先大衛的口說：『列國為甚麼騷動？萬民為甚麼空謀妄想？

words.definition: to be in commotion, to riot
plot in vain, imagine vain things
words.note: An idiom (chengyu) originating from Psalms 2:1.

verses.text: 地上的君王都起來，首領聚在一起，敵對主和他的受膏者。』

words.note: More common in classical or elevated contexts.

verses.text: 希律和本丟．彼拉多，外族人和以色列民，真的在這城裡聚集，反對你所膏立的聖僕耶穌，

words.note: Often refers to non-Jewish people in a biblical context.
Grammatical particle, often indicates a passive or a nominalized verb phrase.

verses.text: 行了你手和你旨意所預定要成就的一切。

words.note: Includes the perfective aspect particle '了'.
Used metaphorically for power or agency.
Grammatical particle, often indicates a passive or a nominalized verb phrase.

verses.text: 主啊，他們恐嚇我們，現在求你鑒察，也賜你僕人們大有膽量，傳講你的道。

words.note: Combination of 'Lord' and exclamatory particle.
Verb 'beg' followed by object 'you', forming a unit.
Formal, often used for gifts from a superior.
Can refer to 'the Way' or God's word.

verses.text: 求你伸手醫治，藉著你聖僕耶穌的名，大行神蹟奇事。」

words.note: Verb 'beg' followed by object 'you', forming a unit.
Used in formal or elevated contexts.
A common biblical idiom for miraculous events.

verses.text: 他們禱告完了，聚會的地方震動起來，他們都被聖靈充滿，放膽傳講　神的道。

words.note: A verb-object compound, lit. 'report prayer'.
Used as a verbal complement indicating commencement or upward movement.
Lit. 'release courage'.
An honorific space used before names of divinity in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to God's word or teaching.

verses.text: 信徒凡物公用全體信徒一心一意，沒有一個人說自己的財物是自己的，他們凡物公用。

words.note: A set phrase describing shared possessions.

words.definition: one in heart and mind, wholeheartedly
words.note: An idiom meaning unity of purpose or thought.
A set phrase describing shared possessions.

verses.text: 使徒大有能力，為主耶穌的復活作見證，眾人都蒙了大恩。

words.note: '主' means Lord.

verses.text: 他們中間沒有一個有缺乏的，因為凡有田產房屋的都賣了，把得到的錢拿來，

words.note: The 'bǎ' particle indicates the object of the verb is being acted upon.

verses.text: 放在使徒腳前，照著各人的需要來分配。

words.note: Often connects an adverbial phrase to a verb, indicating how something is done.

verses.text: 有一個人名叫約瑟，使徒稱他為巴拿巴，就是「安慰者」的意思，他是個利未人，生在塞浦路斯。

words.definition: to be, to be called as

verses.text: 他賣掉了自己的田地，把錢拿來，放在使徒的腳前。

words.note: 掉 often indicates removal or completion.

words.definition: to bring, to take and bring
before the feet, at the feet
words.note: Refers to the place directly in front of someone's feet.
